content.protection: Set of cams .4 to 3" plus one bolt.  2 bolt anchor with chains.  Rap the route.
content.location: The only crack climb on the left side of the cliff.

content.description: Face climb up to the leftmost anchor (single bolt at present).
Several crux moves in the steeper upper section.
content.protection: 2 bolt TR anchor, shares with Little Beaver.
content.location: Go straight up the black streak.

content.description: Generally face climbing with the crux in the middle of the route.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.

content.description: Delicate moves in the upper half of the climb.
content.protection: 2 bolt TR anchor, shares with Stampede.
content.location: Climb up just left of the dark graffiti letter.

content.description: I've been wanting to contribute another easy trad line for this crag. I think it can be fun for the new trad leader wanting to use smaller pieces. La Diagonal is just a thin line that traverses that entire wall. I haven't seen someone else done it trad, so I figured I should add it to the list of routes in Little Beaver Town.
content.protection: Protection is limited. I used 2 small cams near the start of the route ( one 0.4 and another 0.3) - There other possibilities near the start but I thought that would be good enough. If you follow the thin line across the wall you cross the third bolt of Red Ryder, I clipped a quick draw there. Lastly, 10 ft before toping out there will be a pocket - a #2 fits nicely there. To lower you can use the anchor above "You'll Put Yer Eye Out".
content.location: The traverse starts right at the bottom of "Roundup" and traverses left all the way up to the Anchor of the 5.7 crack "You'll Put Yer Eye Out". Follow the thin line that traverses the entire wall.

content.description: Start left of the dihedral (where some willows have been cut by past parties scouting the route perhaps?) You want to move and use finger, hand jams, and some side pulls on the crack that goes up along the left facing dihedral. Keep moving through the crack until you get to crimps. You can top out if you go along the center to a nice ledge. There is a nice small crack west of the ledge. There is a two bolt anchor at the top.There is a 4th class scramble on the west side of dihedral. You can use it to go up and set an anchor to top rope without having to lead it. You can also use it after you clean your anchor to descend.
content.protection: Bring a standard rack. There is two bolt anchor at the top. There is a couple of possibilities along the crack ranging from finger size to full hand jams.
content.location: El Colibri can be spotted as you walk down to the crag, and can be seen left across the Willows when you are on the main area where most folks go to climb. You can follow the "creek" up stream and you will see a small path that will cut through the willows to the base of the climb.

content.description:
This small granite TR area faces north and is hidden from view behind some trees. There are 5 anchors and 6 basic routes.  Routes can be set from the top by approaching from the right.  There are a couple of single bolts back from the edge for setting safety.  The area is named for an old theme park which was once located a bit north of the crag on old Route 66.  

https://www.hiddennewmexico.com/blog/little-beaver-townPRESENTATION: 60th Anniversary of Little Beaver Town Old West Theme Park
